Key Match Events: Andrew Wiggins scored 24 points, Dennis Schroder added 17 points, and the undermanned Golden State Warriors held off the Memphis Grizzlies 121-113.
Lindy Waters III scored 16 points with four 3-pointers off the bench.
Jaren Jackson Jr. scored 23 points and Desmond Bane had 22 points and 10 assists for Memphis.
Physical play became heated 36 seconds into the fourth quarter when Draymond Green was issued a flagrant 1 foul against Zach Edey and later received his ninth technical of the season.
Grizzlies star rookie Jaylen Wells was held to eight points after scoring 30 with eight 3-pointers in a previous game against the Kings.
Wiggins scored seven straight points midway through the third quarter, including a four-point play, helping Golden State take the lead 81-71.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Ja Morant missed his fourth consecutive game and will be re-evaluated once the team returns home.
Stephen Curry rested for the first game of a back-to-back due to knee management.
Brandin Podziemski missed his third straight game due to right abdominal tightness.
Gary Payton II is still nursing a strained left calf and will be evaluated again next week.
